text: by switching to aws we've really
achieved a lot of cost savings we've
improved our margins even though we've
increased the number of servers we have
online significantly
my name is jonathan keebler i'm the cto
and co-founder of scribble live we are
the leading real-time engagement
management solution provider which means
that we work with a lot of companies
that want to cover news or or events in
real time we work with large media
companies around the world in 14
different languages to deliver that
experience customers use scribble live
to cover news on their websites in real
time and engage with their audiences a
lot of large media companies used us to
cover breaking news so if there's a
story breaking somewhere in the world
they're there with their reporters to
cover it and getting those updates out
to their audience in real time
the primary reason we selected aws was
for scale and high availability we
needed to be able to scale up our
servers at the drop of a hat if
something big is going on with one of
our customers and aws had the features
we needed to do that we also had to make
sure that there was no downtime when we
were at peak capacity as we grow we've
really kept our opex in check and
achieved a 35 savings scribble live uses
a huge array of aws products all of our
servers are hosted in ec2 from there
they use elastic cache to help with
caching they use dynamodb to store some
of the data
they use s3 to store all the assets
by switching to aws we've really
improved our margins quite a bit as well
as been able to scale up our software
when needed to support our customers
one great example of where we had to
scale very quickly was during the boston
bombings
boston.com was covering it as a normal
sporting event then all of a sudden
their story took a very different turn
as their website started to shut down
under the traffic load they were able to
throw all that traffic onto scribble
live which was able to scale
using our ec2 instances aws has really
allowed us to keep a small development
team that's really focused on the
customer instead of spending a lot of
time worrying about our systems it's
allowed us to you know make sure that
all the money that we spend on r d goes
to building our application not building
servers
